items.title: 30 years after the founding of ‘Silicon Alley,’ New York’s tech scene is so big it has no center
items.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

items.title: Goldman Sachs leads $75 million funding round for Fieldguide, an AI-native accounting and audit platform
items.description: Valued at $700 million, Fieldguide is combating the ‘existential’ talent crisis for the CPA industry.

items.title: Singapore launches first space agency, joining a Southeast Asian race to tap a fast-growing space sector
items.description: The World Economic Forum predicts the global space economy to exceed $1.8 trillion by 2035, up from $613 billion in 2024.

items.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for renovations after a wave of canceled shows due to Trump adding his name to the building
items.description: Trump announced the closure days after the premiere of “Melania” a documentary of the first lady was shown at the storied venue.

items.title: Trump’s plan to make housing affordable is faltering
items.description: “We’re not going to destroy the value of their homes so somebody who didn’t work very hard can buy a home,” Trump said.
